page.title: 01AREA OF THE SURVEY
page.content: The area of the 1985 survey is on the edge of Telford New Town. The villages of Horsehay, Doseley, and Lawley, are within the boundary of Telford. So is the hamlet of New Works, but not the hamlets of Coalmoor and Huntington. Nor, more importantly, the village of Little Wenlock, which had 618 residents in the 1981 census. Including Little Wenlock, there are about 1,500 residents in the area of the 4 by 3 KM grid. Horsehay, Doseley, and Lawley are communities which were nurtured on coal and iron. They were products of the industrial revolution. Likewise the landscape, bounded by the Wrekin to the north and Buildwas power station to the south, despite its rustic charms, reveals the scars of that revolution. For geologically, the area was rich in coal, iron, lime- stone, and clays. Ripe for exploiting.
